results.title: Barbarosa
results.creator_credit: William D. Wittliff, Fred Schepisi, Alliance, Incorporated Television Company (ITC) and Paul N. Lazarus III
results.brief_description: Karl Westover, an inexperienced farm boy, runs away after unintentionally killing a neighbor, whose family pursues him for vengeance. He meets Barbarosa, a gunman of near-mythical proportions, who is himself in danger from his father-in-law Don Braulio, a wealthy Mexican rancher.

constellations_other.name: Fred Schepisi
constellations_other.description: Fred Schepisi's diverse body of work connects to acclaimed local productions, westerns and Hollywood favourites.

results.creator_credit_for_label: William D. Wittliff, Fred Schepisi, Alliance, Incorporated Television Company (ITC) and Paul N. Lazarus III
results.description: Karl Westover, an inexperienced farm boy, runs away after unintentionally killing a neighbor, whose family pursues him for vengeance. He meets Barbarosa, a gunman of near-mythical proportions, who is himself in danger from his father-in-law Don Braulio, a wealthy Mexican rancher. Don Braulio wants Barbarosa dead for marrying his daughter against the father’s will. Barbarosa reluctantly takes the clumsy Karl on as a partner, as both of them look to survive the forces lining up against them.
description_for_label: Karl Westover, an inexperienced farm boy, runs away after unintentionally killing a neighbor, whose family pursues him for vengeance. He meets Barbarosa, a gunman of near-mythical proportions, who is himself in danger from his father-in-law Don Braulio, a wealthy Mexican rancher. Don Braulio wants Barbarosa dead for marrying his daughter against the father’s will. Barbarosa reluctantly takes the clumsy Karl on as a partner, as both of them look to survive the forces lining up against them.

results.title: Band of Brothers
results.creator_credit: HBO Films, DreamWorks Television, HBO, DreamWorks Pictures, Stephen Ambrose, Gary Goetzman, Erik Bork, Tony To, Erik Jendresen, BBC Television Centre and Playtone
results.brief_description: Drawn from interviews with survivors of Easy Company, as well as their journals and letters, Band of Brothers chronicles the experiences of these men from paratrooper training in Georgia through the end of the war.

constellations_other.name: Conflict to cartoons
constellations_other.description: The Bell and Howell Filmo 70DR was a durable, 16mm camera frequently used by combat photographers like Robert Capa during the Spanish Civil War and Australian Neil Davis in the Vietnam War, but this Constellation goes to some much brighter places.

results.creator_credit_for_label: HBO Films, DreamWorks Television, HBO, DreamWorks Pictures, Stephen Ambrose, Gary Goetzman, Erik Bork, Tony To, Erik Jendresen, BBC Television Centre and Playtone
results.description: Drawn from interviews with survivors of Easy Company, as well as their journals and letters, Band of Brothers chronicles the experiences of these men from paratrooper training in Georgia through the end of the war. As an elite rifle company parachuting into Normandy early on D-Day morning, participants in the Battle of the Bulge, and witness to the horrors of war, the men of Easy knew extraordinary bravery and extraordinary fear - and became the stuff of legend. Based on Stephen E. Ambrose’s acclaimed book of the same name.
description_for_label: Drawn from interviews with survivors of Easy Company, as well as their journals and letters, Band of Brothers chronicles the experiences of these men from paratrooper training in Georgia through the end of the war. As an elite rifle company parachuting into Normandy early on D-Day morning, participants in the Battle of the Bulge, and witness to the horrors of war, the men of Easy knew extraordinary bravery and extraordinary fear - and became the stuff of legend. Based on Stephen E. Ambrose’s acclaimed book of the same name.

results.title: Bananas in Pyjamas
results.brief_description: Bananas in Pyjamas is an Australian children’s television show that premiered on 20 July 1992 on ABC. It has since become syndicated in many different countries, and dubbed into other languages.

constellations_other.name: Learning through play
constellations_other.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

results.description: Bananas in Pyjamas is an Australian children’s television show that premiered on 20 July 1992 on ABC. It has since become syndicated in many different countries, and dubbed into other languages. In the United States, the “Pyjamas” in the title was modified to reflect the American spelling pajamas. This aired in syndication from 1995 to 1997 as a half-hour series, then became a 15-minute show paired with a short-lived 15-minute series The Crayon Box, under a 30-minute block produced by Sachs Family Entertainment titled Bananas in Pajamas & The Crayon Box. Additionally, the characters and a scene from the show were featured in the Kids for Character sequel titled Kids for Character: Choices Count. The pilot episode was Pink Mug.
description_for_label: Bananas in Pyjamas is an Australian children’s television show that premiered on 20 July 1992 on ABC. It has since become syndicated in many different countries, and dubbed into other languages. In the United States, the “Pyjamas” in the title was modified to reflect the American spelling pajamas. This aired in syndication from 1995 to 1997 as a half-hour series, then became a 15-minute show paired with a short-lived 15-minute series The Crayon Box, under a 30-minute block produced by Sachs Family Entertainment titled Bananas in Pajamas & The Crayon Box. Additionally, the characters and a scene from the show were featured in the Kids for Character sequel titled Kids for Character: Choices Count. The pilot episode was Pink Mug.

results.title: Bad Boys
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Don Simpson/Jerry Bruckheimer Films, Sony Pictures, Jerry Bruckheimer, Don Simpson, Michael Bay, John Vallone, George Gallo, Michael Barrie, Jim Mulholland, Bobbie Read and Doug Richardson
results.brief_description: Marcus Burnett is a hen-pecked family man. Mike Lowry is a foot-loose and fancy free ladies’ man. Both are Miami policemen, and both have 72 hours to reclaim a consignment of drugs stolen from under their station’s nose. To complicate matters, in order to get the assistance of the sole witness to a murder, they have to pretend to be each other.

constellations_other.name: Jan Chapman
constellations_other.description: From an independent Sydney cinema to the world's stage, Jan Chapman's work has many connections to the Australian film scene and Hollywood.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Columbia Pictures, Don Simpson/Jerry Bruckheimer Films, Sony Pictures, Jerry Bruckheimer, Don Simpson, Michael Bay, John Vallone, George Gallo, Michael Barrie, Jim Mulholland, Bobbie Read and Doug Richardson
results.description: Marcus Burnett is a hen-pecked family man. Mike Lowry is a foot-loose and fancy free ladies’ man. Both are Miami policemen, and both have 72 hours to reclaim a consignment of drugs stolen from under their station’s nose. To complicate matters, in order to get the assistance of the sole witness to a murder, they have to pretend to be each other.

results.title: Back to the Future
results.creator_credit: U-Drive Productions, Universal Pictures, Amblin Entertainment, Robert Zemeckis, Lawrence G. Paull, Bob Gale, Neil Canton, Deborah Lynn Scott and Ellen Lichtwardt Goodchild
results.brief_description: Eighties teenager Marty McFly is accidentally sent back in time to 1955, inadvertently disrupting his parents’ first meeting and attracting his mother’s romantic interest. Marty must repair the damage to history by rekindling his parents’ romance and - with the help of his eccentric inventor friend Doc Brown - return to 1985.
results.creator_credit_for_label: U-Drive Productions, Universal Pictures, Amblin Entertainment, Robert Zemeckis, Lawrence G. Paull, Bob Gale, Neil Canton, Deborah Lynn Scott and Ellen Lichtwardt Goodchild
results.description: Eighties teenager Marty McFly is accidentally sent back in time to 1955, inadvertently disrupting his parents’ first meeting and attracting his mother’s romantic interest. Marty must repair the damage to history by rekindling his parents’ romance and - with the help of his eccentric inventor friend Doc Brown - return to 1985.

results.title: Babyteeth
results.creator_credit: IFC Films, Amelia Gebler, Create NSW, Whitefalk Films, Screen Australia, Jan Chapman Films, Spectrum Films, WeirAnderson.com, Shannon Murphy, Rita Kalnejais, Alex White and Sherree Phillips
results.brief_description: A terminally ill teen upsets her parents when she falls in love with a small-time drug dealer.

constellations_other.name: Brilliant careers (Gillian Armstrong)
constellations_other.description: Gillian Armstrong's feature film debut not only helped launch her own acclaimed career, but those of the actors as well.

results.creator_credit_for_label: IFC Films, Amelia Gebler, Create NSW, Whitefalk Films, Screen Australia, Jan Chapman Films, Spectrum Films, WeirAnderson.com, Shannon Murphy, Rita Kalnejais, Alex White and Sherree Phillips
results.description: A terminally ill teen upsets her parents when she falls in love with a small-time drug dealer.

results.title: Babe
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Kennedy Miller Productions, Chris Noonan, Bill Miller, Roger Ford, George Miller and Doug Mitchell
results.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 1995
results.brief_description: Babe is a little pig who doesn’t quite know his place in the world. With a bunch of odd friends, Babe realises that he has the makings to become the greatest sheep pig of all time.

constellations_other.name: George Miller
constellations_other.description: For a guy who started his career as a physician, George Miller sure is a diverse filmmaker.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Universal Pictures, Kennedy Miller Productions, Chris Noonan, Bill Miller, Roger Ford, George Miller and Doug Mitchell
results.description: Babe is a little pig who doesn’t quite know his place in the world. With a bunch of odd friends, like Ferdinand the duck who thinks he is a rooster and Fly the dog he calls mum, Babe realises that he has the makings to become the greatest sheep pig of all time, and Farmer Hogget knows it. With the help of the sheep dogs, Babe learns that a pig can be anything that he wants to be.
description_for_label: Babe is a little pig who doesn’t quite know his place in the world. With a bunch of odd friends, like Ferdinand the duck who thinks he is a rooster and Fly the dog he calls mum, Babe realises that he has the makings to become the greatest sheep pig of all time, and Farmer Hogget knows it. With the help of the sheep dogs, Babe learns that a pig can be anything that he wants to be.

results.title: 13th
results.brief_description: An in-depth look at the prison system in the United States and how it reveals the nation’s history of racial inequality.

constellations_other.name: The world's end
constellations_other.description: For people of colour oppressed by systemic racism, genre stories about the end of the world and cosmological monsters can be used to re-examine race and the injustices faced in real life.

constellations_other.name: Confronting injustice on-screen
constellations_other.description: The Black Lives Matter movement and the treatment of African Americans at the hands of authorities is explored in this Constellation that connects hip-hop, the Civil Rights Movement and representation in Hollywood.

results.description: An in-depth look at the prison system in the United States and how it reveals the nation’s history of racial inequality.
description_for_label: An in-depth look at the prison system in the United States and how it reveals the nation’s history of racial inequality.

results.title: 11'09''01 - September 11
results.creator_credit: Galatée Films, CIH Shorts, Catherine Dussart Productions (CDP), Comme des Cinémas, Imamura Productions, La Générale de Production, Les Films 13, Les Films de la Plaine, MISR International Films, Makhmalbaf Film House Productions, Sequence 19 Productions, Sixteen Films, Studio Maj, StudioCanal, Zeta Film (MX), Sabrina Dhawan, Danis Tanović, Ken Loach, Nicolas Mauvernay, Paul Laverty, Jacques Perrin, Claude Lelouch, Alejandro González Iñárritu, Vladimir Vega, Sean Penn, Mira Nair, Youssef Chahine, Amos Gitai, Shōhei Imamura, Samira Makhmalbaf, Idrissa Ouédraogo, Pierre Uytterhoeven, Marie-Jose Sanselme and Daisuke Tengan
results.headline_credit: Bosnia and Herzegovina, Burkina Faso, Egypt, France, India, Iran, Israel, Japan, Mexico, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2002
results.brief_description: Filmmakers from all over the world provide short films – each of which is eleven minutes, nine seconds, and one frame of film in length – that offer differing perspectives on the 9/11 terrorist attacks.

constellations_other.name: Post-9/11
constellations_other.description: The attacks on the World Trader Center in New York City on September 11 2001 were viewed on live television by audiences around the world. The effects of the attack have been explored across various forms of media.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Galatée Films, CIH Shorts, Catherine Dussart Productions (CDP), Comme des Cinémas, Imamura Productions, La Générale de Production, Les Films 13, Les Films de la Plaine, MISR International Films, Makhmalbaf Film House Productions, Sequence 19 Productions, Sixteen Films, Studio Maj, StudioCanal, Zeta Film (MX), Sabrina Dhawan, Danis Tanović, Ken Loach, Nicolas Mauvernay, Paul Laverty, Jacques Perrin, Claude Lelouch, Alejandro González Iñárritu, Vladimir Vega, Sean Penn, Mira Nair, Youssef Chahine, Amos Gitai, Shōhei Imamura, Samira Makhmalbaf, Idrissa Ouédraogo, Pierre Uytterhoeven, Marie-Jose Sanselme and Daisuke Tengan

results.title: [CENSORED]
results.creator_credit: Arenamedia, Chloé Brugalé and Sari Braithwaite
results.brief_description: An essay film by filmmaker and archivist Sari Braithwaite, [Censored] offers an overview of film censorship in Australia, told through an ever-changing collage of images compiled from the footage that was cut from films released domestically between 1958 and 1971.

constellations_other.name: My Hometown: Archives woven into new narrative
constellations_other.description: Offering viewers a snapshot of life on the road for an Australian touring band in the 1960s, 'My Hometown', directed by Sari Braithwaite was developed reimagining archival 8mm footage shot by drummer Leon Isackson.

constellations_other.name: Copy, transform and combine
constellations_other.description: You will see me (2020) repurposes material sourced from the history of the moving image – archival footage, news, interviews, documentaries, reality TV, video diaries and social media – to reflect on the way we perform in front of and reveal ourselves to the camera.

results.description: An essay film by filmmaker and archivist Sari Braithwaite, [Censored] offers an overview of film censorship in Australia, told through an ever-changing collage of images compiled from the footage that was cut from films released domestically between 1958 and 1971.
